Their crimes against humanity must be punished. They have to be stopped.
I agree. It seems for now we can move forward together against this threat.
I don't think I like this...
I think I know what happened to the Bloodthirsty... We've seen large skeletons emerging from the Pits.
There! The Vitriol that they stole from one of our encampments recently is between us and their Refinery.
Doesn't look like any of the Raider vehicles I've seen.
It is a prototype made to ride the Pits. The development was unfinished and it looks to have been greatly modified.
With that Vitriol out of way, we should set our sights on the refinery.
We're going to meet some strong opposition, it is sure to be heavily guarded.
These Forsaken... Why exactly were they cast out?
Their methods were too brutal and fiendish. They tortured and killed our own people. The Forsaken cast themselves out with their actions.
Raiders that are too brutal? I wouldn't have imagined such a thing existed.
It does when they are a threat to everyone, including their own people.
The Sulfuris is a powerful and cruel weapon. How could you let them colonize here?
When we cast them out into the Pits we did not expect them to survive, nor turn their hell into their salvation.
Should we really be helping the Raiders fight the Forsaken?
If their Sulfuris technology was able to dispatch those Bloodthirsty with such ease, I am afraid we have to.
We've made it, let's shut the Refinery down!
The refinery is down, we should push forward to their extraction site to cut off the Sulfuris supply.
I hope we can end this madness before their weapon is finished.
How exactly are they extracting it? What in the seven hells is that thing coming out of the Pit?
More stolen re-purposed technology, The Neurological Operating eXcavator, or N.O.X. for short.
Neurological? Why would an excavation tool need a brain?
The Sulfuris Pits are a dangerous place, excavation requires fast reflexes and thinking, something a simple mindless tool cannot provide.
Does that mean we have to worry about the N.O.X. fighting back when we shut it down?
It shouldn't, unless they tampered with it's programming I should be able to easily issue the shutdown command.
The Forsaken are coming straight at us! Though they don't seem to see us...
What is all this commotion? What are the Forsaken running from!?
The N.O.X. Status screen reads "Excavation target acquired. Deploying heavy ordinance." Its not accepting the shutdown command.
This is bad. This is very bad!
Damn! We are too late. They've finished their weapon!
That means we have to destroy it while we still have the chance.
The hulking machine is in the Forsaken's last foothold in the Sulfuris Pits. If we can root them out we should be able to put an end to their reign of terror on this land.
Then let us dispatch them with haste.
Can we not catch a break? These attack parties are slowing us down, we need to get to the weapon before it's launched.
Let them try to stop us, we'll render their warriors silent and put an end to their evil.
Their weapon does seem quite powerful. We may be able to take control of it and use it to hunt down all surviving Forsaken.
I do not think that to be wise; the weapon needs to be demolished. If you use it, how are you any better than they are?
This is not about being better, its about survival! You did not live in their terror. They need to be eradicated from existence, not just defeated. We can destroy the weapon after they are all dead.
You're mad!
I knew this was a terrible idea, you dare turn on us!?
Raiders, retreat! I will not forget this day, you can handle the weapon yourselves - but we will have our vengeance on the Forsaken.
The machine is attacking. Evasive maneuvers, strike back at its core and turn this hunk of metal into scrap!
Ugh... That was a rough fall. Where in the Seven Hells are we?
Sir! I think we found the Bloodthirsty we were tracking.
Fighting the Forsaken woke something up down here. It caused a collapse and made us fall.
Well we're in the thick of it now! We need to slice our way out of here.
Looks to me that some of the Forsaken we were fighting survived the fall, but they did not survive the Bloodthirsty.
I wonder if Yurich and the Raiders got away before the collapse?
Let's not concern ourselves with those that betray us.
Any plans on how to get out of here?
By climbing the corpses of our foes.
Our dead bodies would join our foes in that corpse pile if we tried to fight that long.
That far cavern wall looks like it might be scalable... but we're going to have to deal with that monstrosity in front of us first.
Speaking of which... what exactly is this thing we're approaching? I cannot tell where the teeth end and the mouth begins.
By the look of it, I would venture a guess that these are not the Bloodthirsty we tracked here... it looks like it lives here.
A Bloodthirsty colony under the Sulfuris Acid Pits? I guess they'll be tough to kill... I love a challenge!
There's not enough teeth in this cavern to kill me.
The amount of Bloodthirsty keeps increasing... Over there! That cave sort of looks like an exit.
Are we sure there are exits? I still think scaling that far off wall would be better.
I'd rather not risk our lives rock climbing with Bloodthirsty nipping at our heels.
Well well, if it isn't our friends the Imperials.
I had hoped I wouldn't have to see your face again any time soon Yurich.
I realize I was being no better than the Forsaken. You were right, destroying the weapon should have been enough.
I don't think we have time for your apology.
Honestly, I wouldn't mind leaving you here to meet your end by the tentacles in this cavern.
We can work together and get out alive, or split up and make this cavern our permanent home. Don't be a fool.
Very well, we'll lead you to safety as soon as we figure out where safety is... but I have my eye on you.
So what exactly is the plan?
We're going to try seeing if there is an exit in that glowing red cave.
You mean that ominous glowing blood red cave behind a gigantic Bloodthirsty? Are you insane?
We don't have much of a choice!
More Bloodthirsty to conquer. I care not how large the beast, only more for me to slay!
Well this cave is a bust. All we did was wake up more Bloodthirsty!
Pretty big ones at that!
Does this mean we have found our graves?
Not quite. On the other side of that giant snake-looking monstrosity is a wall that looks like it can be scaled.
Getting to where we could even think about scaling that wall would require quite the boost up how exactly do you plan on doing that?
Remember what I said about climbing the corpses of our enemies?
I did not think you were serious.
That Bloodthirsty looks like it has enough mass to get us where we need to go provided we kill it first.
Why do Octane's plans always include getting into the biggest fight possible?
The hard fights are the fights that end up mattering in your life Yurich.
We're almost to the end of this nightmare If we make it out alive we're going to reek of Bloodthirsty entrails for weeks.
A fitting trophy considering they want us inside their entrails.
Watch out! This creature seems to be controlling the other Bloodthirsty.
Domino effect, kill the leader and the rest will follow - this is our way out, don't hold back!
Do as you are commanded!
No, this mission is against everything I stand for.
You will comply or you will be stripped of rank and sentenced to death.
Very well, old man. I am not your puppet and will not do your dirty work for you.
All units in the area, this is not a drill. Tabitha has betrayed us. I want her brought in dead or alive.
Fellow Imperials! You're blind to his ways comrades, think for yourselves.
Do not listen to her pleas to convert you. You are all subjects of the Imperial Army, unlike this back stabbing traitor.
It is not I that has stabbed anyone in the back, Halcyon. This "mission" you want me to do is nothing but betrayal to our allies in their time of need. A role I will not partake.
It is for the good of our people and the vision of our goals. Your small minded view of the world will be your undoing.
I will fight for what is right regardless of what the implications are. You cannot quell justice with your atrocious acts of war.
You will be silenced. Attention Cain's Outpost! See that Tabitha and her supporters meet their end.
Imperial Dark Ops touching down in Valhalla Station. Preparing to engage the threat.
Good, keep me updated on your progress. The enemy has gotten far enough past friendly lines.
Octane, Stop this madness!
What is the meaning of this? Tabitha, why are you with enemy forces?
Do not let her distract you, she is leading these traitors.
I am no traitor!
Tabitha... If you've turned your back on the Imperials, then you have to be a traitor.
But I have not turned my back on the Imperials, only on Halcyon.
I am the Imperials! You are nothing but whelps without me.
You dare to say you are Imperial when you operate in the shadows and use assassination plots against our allies!?
Sir. Engaging Tabitha's forces. I am going to apprehend her.
Kill her! Her fate has already been sealed. Send her to the Seven Hells where she belongs.
Octane, I won't hesitate if you are going to follow his lies. Do what you know is right!
Halcyon, I will not kill her.
You forget your place. If you aid the traitors then you share their fate.
I would like to see you try to stop us. I've slain every foe that has ever dared cross me.
We need to get out of Valhalla Station. Retreat now, we can threaten Halcyon later.
We're not going to be able to escape with The Intrepid on our tails. We're going to have to make a stand.
Very well, we'll destroy The Intrepid and then escape through the valley.
You are not wise if you think you can escape my grasp. This ship is the strongest in my fleet.
We may not be able to match its power, but our strategy is greater and we are on the side of justice.
These traitors are more foolish than I could have imagined. Helmsman, bring us forth and prepare to fire on the port bow!
Here it comes... I hope we live through this.
We will rain fire on Valhalla from the heavens, and if worst comes to worst... it is a good day to die!
We're still on the trail of the Righteous... what would they be doing here?
Isn't this island where we encountered the Progenitors last? I had hoped we wouldn't ever have to return.
I'm intercepting a transmission nearby.
Sir! We have encountered a deployment of Imperials on the island.
Dispatch them quickly. We cannot let them interfere with our operations.
These Righteous are... up to something. Something big.
The Imperials are crushing us. Request Heimdar loadout.
Very well. I have commanded Heimdar to aid you.
What's a Heimdar?
One of the 12 Gatekeepers of the Righteous Holy Order. The colossus that stands before us.
Engaging the enemy on retreat. Heimdar is descending upon them.
That thing is attacking, watch out.
Get out of my way you Righteous hunk of junk!
Sir, I have grim news. The Imperials have bested Heimdar.
Continue your retreat and wait for air support. We must ready the Olympus Fragment before the Imperials stop us.
Olympus Fragment? What is that all about?
It could be Progenitor technology given our location... but I honestly don't know.
My transmission receiver seems to be malfunctioning... There's a signal forcing its way through!
Imperials. Turn back now. If you venture further into the island we will cleanse your people from history.
What's that? You want a fight?
Your aggression lacks divine order. We will restore order to the universe.
History? Universe? It sounds like the Olympus Fragment may be very powerful.
A power that no man should be able to wield if they aren't lying.
We are not men, we are gods!
The Righteous aren't well known liars...
Then it's an actual problem. We'll have to stop them!
Dactyl, protect Antalya and stop these cretins from disrupting the cleansing.
We don't have time for this! We need to get to the Patriarch and stop this madness.
Nothing can beat us Tabitha. There's no power in time or space that can stop me!
We've slain the Dactyl, but I fear we may be too late to stop them.
Nonsense, we keep marching!
All forces, stop the Imperials in their tracks. The Olympus Fragment has activated and we're almost to the promised land.
We're doing our best to resist them sir, but they are breaking through our ranks.
And we're not going to stop!
We've got them against the ropes.
No foe is a match for me... least of all you Righteous fools!
No, no, no. Kill them! We just need to make some final adjustments to slay the Bloodthirsty. We can end all of our enemies. Perfect order must be achieved!
All Righteous form on the Olympus Fragment. We are the last line of defense to ensure our goals are met.
Fellow Righteous, your sacrifices will not be in vain, for in the new order you will be kings and our enemies will have never existed.
Protect the Olympus Fragment, it is our salvation!
More zealots to slay.
You are too late! Witness the divine power of order and stay your feet.
Ugh! This power is overflowing from the island... we have to stop it.
Full force. Destroy the Progenitor structure and end this madness!
Where... Where are we? We were trying to destroy that Progenitor structure then...
Everything got blindingly bright. Blew out the sensor in my eye.
This looks like Ashrock... but that spire in the distance is not the spire I remember.
We're being attacked by Bloodthirsty!
It seems its more than Bloodthirsty. We're also surrounded by Xeno! And Raiders! And Righteous... and Imperials... Something is very off.
They're all emitting a strange green glow.
Arghhh!
What's wrong?
My ears are ringing. Ugh... it stopped. We need to get out of here.
Large Bloodthirsty incoming!
It looks oddly familiar...
Didn't we kill this thing when we escaped from the Cavern of Blood?
If we killed it once, we can kill it again!
That kill felt more satisfying the second time around... hope we can fight it again some day.
I would rather not fight that thing again.
It looks like the glow is emitting from the Spire as well. Maybe we can stop these attackers if we shut the Spire down?
You want to ruin all the fun of crushing all these foes?
There's plenty of foes to crush on the way there. We can't fight forever.
This headache is killing me... What the heck is this thing in the way of the Spire?
More foes to crush. I could fight forever!
I think it's Imperial technology, but what is it doing here?
I suspect there is something bigger going on here than we realize.
It looks like a GDR-5000... but its different. Same green glow as the others.
It looks like scrap metal to me!
Alright we beat... it... now... ugh... I...
Tabitha? What's wrong?
Octane... kill... me...
No I cannot. I've sworn to protect you!
You are a fool to challenge us. But you are interesting... why are you not affected by Mesmerize's power of control?
Leave her alone! I swear I will crush you and everything you've ever loved if you do not free her.
How long do you think you can fight us without killing her? Without her killing you?
Nothing strikes fear into my heart. I will end your power over her by destroying your toys.
Destroying the Spire will only make us pause. Mesmerize's power exceeds all bounds.
No mortal can destroy Mesmerize. We will control all. All will be one.
You assume I'm only human. No one will ever control me!
Asphodel... No...
Drastic times call for drastic measures Typhon. The Nexus belongs to the Imperials.
You are a fool Halcyon. The Nexus's powers vastly exceed your pitiful comprehension.
Am I the one fleeing from battle right now? Who's the fool Typhon?
I may be down... but I am not out. The bodies you have buried this day will be avenged. Asphodelians! Make way to the tunnel system.
You cannot escape us! Lay down your arms and surrender.
Halcyon, you seem to forget that you're still in my territory. I still have some advantage. Aileron! Cover our escape.
Delaying the inevitable once again I see. Imperials, blast this Aileron out of the sky!
We've got to keep moving, the Imperials are gaining on us!
Quit while you still can Asphodelians. Your city is in ruin, your lands desolate. Accept your fate and surrender yourselves.
We will never give up! We will never surrender!
Typhon, I know how you must feel, but there is no honor in running. Kneel before your conquerors.
We won't run forever. In fact we're not running anymore. Asphodelians, about face! Ready the Protomech!
More aggression instead of seeking mercy? Typical. This move smells of desperation.
It is a trap that I have laid for you, that you walked directly into. You are a worthless tactician.
Your Protomech has not stopped us before, it won't stop us now. Stay your feet and accept defeat!
RES-Omega, please check in.
Copy my liege.
Confirm that Bloodthirsty activity in the area has ceased.
Can confirm that the area has been cleansed. Blight activity is non-existent in the ruins.
Excellent. Your squad may return to the Citadel.
Hold on... There seems to be a surge of activity nearby... It's Xeno!
The Xeno returning to their ruins... and only now that the Bloodthirsty are gone. Interesting.
Orders sir?
See what you can glean from their activities, but stay hidden.
We have been encountering heavy hostile forces, but I do not think we've set off their alarms yet.
If they are there for something important there should be at least a Class 4 Xeno. Do you see anything matching that description?
There is a large Xeno in the water... should we engage?
No. Wait until they have found what they are looking for then report back to me.
I'm sorry sir, that doesn't seem to be possible, the Class 4 Xeno has detected us.
Very well. Cease their operation, those ruins are ours now.
It seems to have found what it was looking for in the struggle.
What do you mean? Report!
A Class 5 Xeno has descended from the sky. The area is swarming with Xeno activity!
Request backup!
Request denied. You know the rules, until the quarantine has been lifted I cannot send our people to an area that may be unclean.
But my liege, I have already confirmed that the Blight has been cleared.
As well as that may be, there is obviously something afoot. Get out on your own. Those that fall behind stay behind.
Most of their resources seem to be focusing on excavating something from the ruins. We'll use this opportunity to evacuate.
Rescind previous order and stay your feet. If you're able to recover whatever they are there for it would shine brightly on your future in the eyes of the Elder Council.
If we remain it would be suicide!
I have faith in your abilities. Have faith in yourselves. Find what they are looking for and take it for the greater good of our people.
Hrmmm... Yes, my liege.
The excavation drones are concentrated on the island. Their goal must be there!
Recommend disabling the drones before attempting extraction.
By the Glory of Talos, we will bring them down!
Righteous caravan spotted. They seem to be launching an assault on Tartarus in this sector just as you expected.
Do not let them through. The Blight is our power, our edge, against our enemies.
Stop, Righteous scum! You should not have stepped foot in Tartarus.
You are misguided. The Bloodthirsty must be cleansed from our world.
Leave or I will put a bullet in that pretty skull of yours.
Then shoot. We're not leaving without completing our mission!
My pleasure.
Stop toying around. Kill them!
Get off my back. I'm running this operation.
You should know better than to disobey me.
Hrrnnghhh!...Yes, sir.
The caravan's advance is nearing the bridge. We will ambush them there. Looks like they've brought some powerful units.
I will not accept any excuses. Do not let them get into the heart of Tartarus.
Stand aside, Raider!
You think your worthless mechs can tangle with me? I will crush you!
I managed to stop their frontal assault, but they've brought in a flying transport carrying what looks like... some sort of Xeno bomb.
So that is their plan? Very well. Shoot it down, but see that you don't set the bomb off.
You want me to fire on a potential explosive?!
See to it how you will, but if that device reaches the heart it will be the least of your worries.
Your plans are always crap. I'll board their transport from the bridge.
Fine. Careful not to die, I wouldn't want to have to come deal with the problem myself.
Core Carrier, your path is clear. Engage and move toward the target.
Look at these adorable Righteous coming to play with the big boys. Looks like I'm going to have to take out the trash.
Evade their defenses. Deploy the Class 7 Core!
Like hell you will!
What is the situation?
Boarding the enemy transport! I will tear them out of the sky.
Report. I need your report soldier. Barracus... can you hear me?
An explosion... the Deidon is down, but the Bloodthirsty are going insane.
I am losing my grip over them...
I need to get out of here!
Some Righteous made it out alive, but there are plenty left that are being converted by the Blight.
Do you see any large Bloodthirsty in the area? Something is blocking my control.
In the gorge below there's a very large one. Do you think that it could be the cause?
It must be. Slay the beast so I can regain control of the Bloodthirsty or you will surely perish in Tartarus.
Another disgusting Bloodthirsty monstrosity. I'd kill it for fun!
I feel some strength returning to me, but the Bloodthirsty are still not obeying my command... I am coming over there.
I... I can't... I... Ugh...
What's the problem? You're breaking up.
I SEE YOU...
Barracus?
NO. THIS VESSEL HAS BEEN TOUCHED BY THE BLIGHT AND IS WITHIN MY GRASP. I AM KALIHMAH.
Barracus, snap out of it. You answer to me!
THERE IS NO BARRACUS. LEAVE MY CHILDREN ALONE. YOU HAVE CORRUPTED THEIR PERFECTION.
I will rip you apart! You cannot take my power from me!
THIS POWER WAS NOT MEANT FOR YOU.
GO, MY CHILDREN. CONSUME THIS HERETIC WHERE HE STANDS.
I am the supreme ruler of Tartarus and high king of the Raiders. No filthy beast such as this stands a chance!
Arctis HyperSec Prison is in view. Moving in to secure the package.
May your sword be guided by the wisdom of the Sentinels. Your mission is of utmost importance.
There seems to be a weak amount of resistance in the area. I haven't set off any alarms yet, but it seems some of our intel was either faulty or outdated.
Resistance or not, you need to get Emrys now. The timing is not forg... iving, we only... ha... ve... one... ch... ance.
You're breaking up. Damn this blasted mountain!
Emrys! I'm here to rescue you.
We're going to have a rough time getting out of here. The alarm has been tripped.
Alarm or not, we need you out of here. Hold on!
We must be on the move. We don't want to be caught by the Steel Sheriff.
We'll escape through the pass. Go, go, go!
Sound all the alarms! Report to Halcyon. We're hunting them down now.
Elder Constantine, come in. The package is secured but extraction is not going as smoothly as planned. Sir? Do you read me?
The alarm systems emit transmission blocking frequencies. We're never going to be able to contact the Order while we are still near the prison.
Emrys, cease and desist. If you do not turn yourself in we will authorize lethal force.
They're tracking us... I don't know how.
An implant. They tag everyone that is admitted into HyperSec.
Well we're going to have to remove that. Where is it?
My heart.
How are we supposed to remove it!?
It would take a very skilled surgeon. However I think that this is the least of our problems right now.
Why do you say that?
They have found us.
S.S. you have my authorization to terminate the target with extreme prejudice.
SURRENDER OR DIE.
I choose death!
You know Octane, I never thanked you for saving my life. Thanks.
Think nothing of it. I expect you would have done the same given the circumstances.
I am tired of fighting through these hordes of Progenitors though. What do we need to do to get out of here already?
Tired of fighting?! Ha. I will take on your share. I will fight to the end of time if I have to.
Maybe if we can find a device similar to what brought us here in the first place?
Or if we can kill whatever that thing that mind controlled you before? I like the killing plan more.
But look out there. Do you see that big glowing structure in the distance?
Yes. It looks somewhat familiar... what could it be?
I think we should investigate. It could be our ticket home.
Well we're going to have to fight through a bunch of Progenitor scum on the way. I like it!
Speaking of Progenitor scum.
This thing is huge.
Stand back, I'll take care of it!
Great. You always have to show off. Now the jungle is swarming with Progenitors.
Hey! You can't blame me for carrying out my basic instincts. Besides, there's more slaying to be done now!
Ugh, can we please make our way towards the structure?
Hang on, there's a monster of a Progenitor over there. We really shouldn't turn our backs to it.
Next time I decide to get lost in an alternate dimension with someone, I am going to try and make sure they are the stealthy type.
Stealth is for cowards. Come on, let's take it out!
Well it sees us now. That's for sure. Incoming!
I'll beat it to death with its own tentacles!
Well at least you scared it off.
Come back here Progenitor! Don't you want your arm back? Ha ha!
When we get back, you should probably seek some sort of counselling.
You are just jealous of my prowess in battle.
Sure. Anyway, can we get back to what we were doing please?
We're almost to the entrance of the structure. Very interesting looking.
We must tread softly. I don't know what this thing is or does. If it's a weapon we'll want to be able to escape it at a moment's notice.
Tread softly? If it's a weapon we'll destroy it. Pay no heed to danger, shoot first and ask questions later.
Well it seems there's some sort of security system in place... and you've set it off.
Good! I was getting bored without a challenge. Give me your best shot you hunk of scrap!
I do not want your insolent excuses. I want you to find them! Bring me their heads!
Apologies my liege. Their trail went cold at Alpha Island.
Those two traitorous dogs think they can just turn their backs on the Imperial regime.
Sir... I just received an urgent report.
Out with it!
There seem to be some intruders at Valhalla Station.
They are Righteous, sir.
Those fanatics are crossing a line by stepping foot here. We will destroy them. Send a message that no one can infiltrate our bases and live.
I'm reading a large mass of energy at the base. They have an Armament!
Your orders, sir?
They will not stand up to Imperial technology. I will destroy it personally.
Stay your hand Halcyon, this station is now forfeit!
Like hell it is.
How exactly does one of Typhon's dogs get to fighting for the Righteous anyway?
You do not know what you are talking about. Don't ask questions you don't want the answers to, old man.
Ha! Well you can pack up your toys and leave. If you are quick, I might not put a bullet in the back of your head.
You couldn't hit me if the barrel of your gun was against my chest.
Emrys! Through the base, you'll find what you're looking for on the other side. I'm going to hold these Imperial losers back. Do what you need, but do it fast!
What exactly are you getting at? Nikolas, follow them. Find whatever it is they are doing and stop them.
Aye sir!
You should have turned tail and ran while you had the chance, old man.
Strong words for someone intruding on my land. Bow down to me and I will make your death swift.
Ugh...
Time to die.
Halcyon! Come quick!
Hmph. Stay dog.
Report!
This Righteous sir... he's amassing a great amount of power at the peak!
Stand down, you can not stop the Ascension.
Aside, cur! Or did you not witness the beating I gave poor little Barracus?
No matter, I will stand between you and the Ascension if it's the last thing I do.
Then it will be the last thing you do!
Argh!
Unlike your master, I will finish what I started.
Nikolas... No!
Emrys! I need your aid.
You killed Nikolas! I will show no mercy upon all of you filthy Righteous!
The Ascension is complete. The power of the Sentinels flows through me. Bow down to me, foolish mortal.

mission.name: Intrepid In Space!
mission.desc: Fight through the near endless forcefields to stop the Imperials from taking down the Worldship!

speech.line: It has been a long time since I have seen the green glow of this dire place.
So why exactly are we here?
Were you not briefed? There has been a lot of activity in the area. We're not sure if it's the Forsaken back at it or something worse.
Well... from the looks of things, I am going to guess it is something worse.
The Bloodthirsty!? I thought they might have died when we escaped the caverns.
You mean you've seen these Bloodthirsty before?
It's a long story. These Bloodthirsty are especially dangerous. Born and bred in the Sulfuris itself, deep underneath these lands.
So we should leave then?
No, we have a mission to complete. If the activity is considered hostile, we are to terminate it. I consider these Bloodthirsty very hostile.
They're swarming all over the Refinery. If we can take that, we may be able to use the Sulfuris to our advantage.
Sir, I don't think they are swarming all over the Refinery. I think the Refinery is a Bloodthirsty!
Seven Hells!
It's huge. How are we supposed to kill this monstrosity?
At least it is not very mobile. Dodge its attacks and strike back!
That was a bloody mess.
There's more Bloodthirsty emerging from the pits!
Off in the distance, there is a gigantic flying beast.
One step at a time. We're surrounded!
Cut a path through here. I've got your back!
We really should be using a larger force.
Resources are spread thin. We'll make do with what we have.
Since we're going to be here a while, how about you tell me that long story?
It's not something I am proud of.
Come on. If we're to die, I do not want to die curious.
I worked with some Imperials here before. We fell into the cavern below. I had to beg for mercy.
If the Imperials had not forgave me for attempting to steal the Forsaken technology... I might have died.
We'd all do the same if it meant saving our skins.
It's more than that. Those two Imperials seemed different than their brethren. Much how we are different from ours.
No time to get sentimental. The beast approaches.
Let's ground this monster!
Another beast slain. Here I thought we might actually have a challenge!
What's that sound?
The earth is quaking beneath us. All the Bloodthirsty are going insane!
Seven hells.
That is a rather large foe.
I thought we killed it...
What are you talking about?
Before, we faced off with this monster in the caverns below and scaled its corpse to escape.
Well it seems alive and well to me.
We'll have to change that.
If Octane could slay this beast with such finesse, I am sure that we can finish the job properly this time.
Watch out! It's attacking!
Reporting for duty sir.
At ease. We've got a situation here in the Wasteland.
There have been reports of Xeno activity. Our mission is to cease their operations, and if possible claim any of their technology.
Stealing from the invaders seems like a suicide mission.
Only if they know we've stolen from them. We've got a new machine that is jamming their comms. They are effectively in the dark.
What about escapees?
Dead Xeno tell no tales.
As you wish, sir. We'll eliminate all hostiles.
There is the general. If we can take him out, we might be able to send their troops into disarray and defeat them swiftly.
There's only one way to find out. Here it comes!
Blast! He got away.
Tracking his movements.
Looks like he's headed for the Nexus?
Hold on... looks like we have bigger fish to fry.
Some sort of drone dispatcher... they're trying to make contact outside the atmosphere!
Shoot them down, I want everyone to focus fire on the drones. We need to head for the Xeno releasing them.
Raiders! Fire at will! If you let a single drone escape the entire operation will be thrown into jeopardy.
Approaching the beast emitting the drones now.
The drones... they've changed course. They're congregating around the Nexus!
Ignore them for now. We need to shut this thing down!
The Xeno has stopped emitting drones, but is evading us.
Sir... The Nexus.
Arachis!? How?
The Xeno at the Nexus pulled it through the portal!
The portal to Tartarus?
We don't have time to ask questions. If we don't stop that thing, the Nexus will be destroyed.
It would also make for a great bounty.
You want us to appropriate that thing!?
The bigger the Xeno, the better the technology.
We need to focus our efforts and make a coordinated assault.
I am not sure we have time to coordinate. Arachis has noticed us!
We made it. I thought we would never find home again.
Not like we really have a home. But at least we're in our time.
It looks like Halcyon and his goons are going to launch to Phobos. Maybe we should hitch a ride off this rock?
We have other problems. Raiders... Xeno?
How in the seven hells did this happen? Every time we leave for a second, there is always a big mess to clean up.
I know how you dislike the stealth approach, but if we do not tread lightly we'll never get aboard and we won't be able to stop Halcyon.
Hmph. Very well. We'll try it again, but I make no promises that it will work. I prefer the loudest entrance possible.
Woah, watch out! There's some huge machine on our tail!
See, that didn't last long. I'm smashing this hunk of junk into pieces!
Sir, someone or something destroyed the Volatile.
Redirect forces to the area. Make sure whatever it was doesn't get to the Annihilatron before we've destroyed Halcyon.
So, Yurich thinks he has a chance against me. Ha! Pitiful.
Even with his Xeno toys, these Raiders can not stand against the might of the Imperial Army. We will get to Phobos and crush our foes from the skies.
Well, it seems that Halcyon and the Imperials are more preoccupied with the attack than with us. It doesn't look like they have noticed we're here.
Then let's use this opportunity instead of squandering it on a fight here.
It is still not going to be easy as long as these hybrid machines and Raiders keep attacking us.
We may have to help the Imperials destroy the Xeno and Raider machines if we want to sneak aboard safely.
Help Halcyon? Are you daft?
We need this ride out of here. We'd be shot down if we tried to board.
We'll be shot down if we try to take this route!
All the more reason to help right?
Look, we'll figure it out. But right now we have more pressing matters... like this giant mech attacking us!
Like lambs to the slaughter. Charge!
We're caught in a tractor beam! Increase velocity, but keep power on the shields to deflect their lasers.
More Imperials on our flank!
Wait a second...
It has been ages since we've seen a friendly face.
Yurich! What in the seven hells is going on?
You're alive!? How? I thought Halcyon had you killed.
Listen, we don't have a lot of time to explain. We need to sneak aboard the ship you're attacking.
I don't think that is going to be possible. If we stop attacking all of a sudden Halcyon will know something is up.
I know a simple solution to that. We simply destroy your weapons.
You want me to spare Halcyon? Even if he didn't kill you, he still has comeuppance due.
We can more effectively end his regime if we get to Phobos. Otherwise, although he would be dead, the Imperial Army will simply promote one of Halcyon's generals.
I want to kill him as much as anyone, but sometimes you need to do more than cut the head off a snake.
Very well, I will allow it. We'll put on a good show. The Annihilatron doesn't pull any punches.
Thank you.
Bring it on! Sorry I have to smash your toys, Yurich. Just kidding, I am not sorry!
I can't believe this plan worked.
I can't believe you haven't ruined it yet.
Hey, I can stealth if I want to. I just... never want to.
Quiet. Do you hear that?
How am I supposed to answer? You told me to be quiet.
Soldiers!
Well, at least we got this far. It's more than I expected.
Oh, come on now, this is so much more fun!
We'll never make it to Phobos if we're trapped here. We need to make a break for the escape pods.
If we hurry, we should be able to get out of here guns blazing.
Quick, into the escape pod! Ejection sequence initiated.
What!? How dare they!
Prepare for blast off... what are you going on about?
My Helios... They took my Helios!
Oh, great. And it's coming right for us.
Alright, just this once: let's please not destroy this thing.
I thought you liked destroying "hunks of junk" like this.
This is my "hunk of junk." Whoever is inside is going to pay dearly!
Looks like they got away before we could board.
Well, they can't get too far; that ship lacks lightspeed capabilities.
It's still going to be faster than this pod. We should cut our losses and try to get aboard Phobos quietly.
You think that is still possible after we set off every alarm on the ship and fought a fighter class cruiser? Let's just blow a hole in the side of the station and take it over.
That would activate the station's defenses. We'd likely be disintegrated.
The station's defenses... that's it! You're brilliant!
I'm not sure you heard me correctly. Is all that electricity interfering with your auditory senses?
The station has very powerful external defenses. But it also has strong internal defenses as well. We need it to work for us instead of against us.
And how, exactly, would we do that?
I can interface with the mainframe and overload it. It's built on the same software and hardware that my neuro-implants are.
Well, well, well. Look what we have here.
Halcyon!
I always thought I would rue the day I ran into you two again. But it seems I have the upper hand. Intrepid, engage!
I will take your hand from you, old man.
Oh, I think not. The superiority of Phobos and the Intrepid will end your small life. You will be crushed.
I would have thought by now you would hesitate to underestimate me. Your confidence will be your undoing!
Intrepid, fall back. Begin docking procedures. Phobos, activate defenses - all targeting enemy combatants.
You can run but you can't hide!
Evasive maneuvers. They're throwing everything they've got at us!
We need to get these defenses down. I don't know how much more of this we can take.
We have an opportunity to get in close. We just need to blow a hole in the shields so I can interface with the mainframe.
If we reverse the polarity on the forward lasers we may be able to interrupt the frequency of the shielding in a small, localized area.
It would be a tight fit, but we may be able to get through. I assume you know how to do all that technical mumbo jumbo?
Of course I do.
Firing Lasers!
Looks like the entry is open. Full throttle!
Ahhhhhh!
That was close. We lost an engine.
Good thing we've got another one. Attaching my neural link to an external port.
I don't know how much time we're going to have. Enemy reinforcements inbound!
Hhnggh... The connection was refused. Violently.
So, I assume that means we're in for a fight?
We'll need to find a better connection, but until then... Phobos is gearing up to attack us!
Intrepid! Fall back to Eden. We need to regroup and assess the damage.
This is Eden Access Authority. Please give your credentials.
Intrepid Class Vessel, Halcyon 10-XK-74JDZ
Access granted. Welcome home, Commander.
We need to figure out how to handle this Phobos crisis before the people of Eden catch wind of it. I do not want to risk the chance of a full scale mutiny.
Commander Halcyon!
This better be an emergency.
It is, sir. It seems that someone, or something, has infiltrated the city.
What? How is this possible? Give me a report. Is it Yurich?
It seems it may be Progenitor in origin.
Progenitors?! Impossible.
Well, sir, if you look outside, you'll see that it is not impossible.
Hold your tongue. You will show respect. Now, I will see about taking care of this problem expediently.
It doesn't seem to be too powerful. Find the breach and seal it. We're killing this monster.
Aye aye, sir!
You were a fool, Progenitor, for thinking you stood a chance!
You are an annoying pest.
Sir, more Progenitors inbound!
Someone hasn't been doing their job and will pay dearly for this.
There haven't been any visible integrity failures. They seem to be appearing out of nowhere!
That sounds like an excuse.
There they are! Blast them.
Sir, we should not use this type of force in the residential area. Many people will die from the fallout.
I gave you an order! Do it or I will kill you myself.
Very well, sir. Salvos launched.
What!? How are they still standing?
All those people... killed for nothing...
Wake up, we don't have time to weep for the weak.
The collateral damage is taking a serious toll on the structural integrity of the Aegis. If we continue, we risk exposing the city.
If we don't kill these things, we risk there being no city at all. I expect heavy losses on both sides.
We need to keep in mind the cost!
We will crush them no matter the outcome!
Emergency! Incredibly large Progenitor descending from the sky!
Uruk...
What do we do sir? Why would they come here?
We'll do what we must to defeat them. They are likely drawn to the power beneath our city streets.
The power beneath the streets?
Do not concern yourself with such trivial matters; arm the salvos. I don't care how many casualties we have. We need to take this thing down.
Salvos armed. Launching at your command.
Fire at will. Take it out of the sky.
The attack had very little effect. It's unleashing a swarm of Progenitors on the city!
I will not die like this!
Sir, they're breaking into the comms center! They're tearing us all apart! Do someth-
You'll pay dearly for this Uruk. You will suffer!
Go forth, my children. Bring the Blight to those that would stop us.
*screeeeeeeee*
Bloodthirsty are on the Island!
Silence their cries for help.
Yes, master.
These fools are ill-prepared for the might of the Blight.
We will commune with their flesh!
All workers, retreat to The Reckoning. This is not a drill.
They can run, but they cannot hide. The communion has begun.
Sir, there seems to be something weird going on with the Bloodthirsty attack, they are taking control of the people here with frightening speed.
The virus... Typhon. He must be there. The council will be alerted immediately. Do your best to survive.
Yes, sir.
These foolish mortals do not stand a chance at defeating me. The tendrils of the Blight will crush them beneath us.
Worker mechs, you need to get out of there! Quickly!
Bring your new brothers and sisters into the fold, my children.
Crush them. Crush them all.
*grurghhllllll*
Our hunger cannot be sated.
We're experiencing heavy losses. How long until we have some backup!?
The council is making its decision shortly.
Making its decision? People are dying out here!
We must take down the Loader Bot. It is the only way to ensure the total assimilation of the Righteous on this island.
*grawwwww* They hurt us.
Worry not, my children, the pain we will give them will be insurmountable.
Backup forces are on the way.
I pray that it won't be too late.
Tear it all down. Lay waste to our enemies.
Destroy, destroy, destroy!
Thank the Sentinels, the forces are arriving.
Puny mortal. Thank you for bringing more vessels for the Blight.
Ahhh! What is this power? How are you speaking into my mind?
It's the virus. You've been infected. It is only a matter of time before you will bend to my will.
Impossible!
You will join us. You will commune with the Blight.
*screech* Communion!
Constantine, they... they are in my mind!
There is a cure developed. But it is limited in supply, reserved for only the highest members of the order.
My liege, please do not forsake me.
A cure? Your mind was a good one to listen to.
Get out of my head!
It is too late for you. Give in to the Blight.
No! I will fight you until the bitter end.
Youre going to regret saying that the rest of your life - both seconds of it.
There are some crazy power readings going on near Alpha Island.
Should we check it out?
Yes, but let's try not to get sucked into any wormholes to Progenitor dimensions this time.
What the... some sort of Bloodthirsty monster is rising out of the ocean!
Ple... Come in... Comman... The Bloodthirsty are overpowering...
We're receiving a signal; it looks like it's the Righteous.
Righteous, this is Tabitha. Please repeat your message.
Tabitha? Of the Imperials? Run. The Bloodthirsty are overpowering us at Alpha Island. Typhon has returned.
Typhon?!
We've got help on the way, Empress. Someone that has fought Typhon before.
Constantine, I sense something... different... about Typhon. I feel Kalihmah's presence within him.
Barracus, the traitor. I was a fool to let you leave Tartarus with your life. Now, Tartarus and Acheron will merge in my grand vision and you will die.
Seven hells! Will you look at the size of that thing?
What is going on? How is this happening?
You puny mortals stand no chance against the full power of the Blight. Bow to your master.
Incoming attack!
I welcome the opportunity to destroy a worthy foe like this!
Octane, I've got you!
Well well, look who decided to show up and save my hide. You're an odd one, Yurich.
We don't have time for pleasantries.
Yurich.
Barracus.
Shouldn't you be helping Typhon?
He has forsaken the Raiders, just as he has forsaken you. This is everyone's problem.
If it isn't my puppets. You should know better than to stand up to me.
Okay, so conventional tactics don't really work here. Does anyone have an idea how we can end this thing? Maybe we could use Phobos?
The Reckoning has taken severe damage. We were able to clear a shot but it didn't make much of a difference.
Well, no offense, but your little cannon is a toy compared to our space station.
All will become one. The genesis of a new Tartarus and the end of Acheron. Rejoice, my children.
It's massive! I can't tell where his mass ends and the ocean begins.
Bigger they are, the harder they fall.
Phobos, you're clear for activation. Fire at will.
Hahahahaha, you dont get it, do you, puny mortals?
It's not going to be enough!
We need to coordinate an offensive. Strike all at once.
Even if we manage to puncture through, I'm not sure we can actually do enough damage.
Yurich, do you still have access to that Xeno technology? Maybe between Phobos, The Reckoning, and Annihilatron we can force an opening.
This is a longshot.
The theory is sound. But we'll still need to be ready to attack at the point of entry.
Crossing the power of these weapons is crazy, but it just might work.
You insolent fools. You cannot possibly match my power!
So, any chance we can get that shot off before he kills every living thing on Acheron?
The chances don't look to be in our favor. He's attacking again!
We have to move fast. Empress, get The Reckoning up and running! Barracus, you're with me. Octane...
Save it. I know what I'm doing. Tabitha, you get Phobos' cannons online. I'm going in.
You're mad. There's no way you'd survive the initial attack.
Listen, someone has to go in and rip its heart out. Who'd be better at this than me? Punch a hole through it and I'll go in.
Be careful, Octane. Everyone, get into position!
You better not die on me.
Don't worry, only one tyrant is dying tonight. There isn't enough room for both of us in the underworld.
Welcome back to Eden, sir.
I trust the reconstruction is on schedule?
Yes, we are just about to reactivate the defense network, and...
We're under attack!
Give me a status report! Who is attacking us?
It's the Xeno. Krellus has returned.
They must be after the Nexus. There's no way I'm letting them get their hands on it.
Foolish Xeno, I'll simply crush them with the Intrepid. Helmsman, prepare for liftoff...
*THOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOM*
I'm hit! Losing altitude... Brace for...
Our air support is taking heavy losses! If you launch now, you'll be cut to shreds!
We can't just sit here and let them take the Nexus!
I have a plan - I'll take my men and disable that mech. You stay here and launch the Intrepid as soon as it's down.
Very well. But come back alive. That's an order, Commander.
Yes sir.
Alright men, let's show this ugly hunk of scrap who it's messing with.
Locked and loaded.
Tonight we're dinin' on squids!
The mech is down, you are clear to launch.
Get us airborne, on the double!
Even with their anti-air mech down, we are still at a stalemate.
We have our defense network, but they are exhibiting unusually good maneuvering and coordination.
The Xeno formations are centered around that huge flyer.
It must be the one controlling them. I will take it down and take back our skies.
And then, we will purge our city of these vermin.
Fire the main cannon!
*BWWOOOOOOOOOOOOOMMMMMMM*
No effect. The target seems to have some kind of energy dispersion barrier that negated the shot.
Then we will just have to attack the old fashioned way.
Accelerate to ramming speed!
The Xeno are in disarray! Air superiority is ours!
Good, now advance and reclaim the Nexus.
Valhalla Station, reporting in. Our perimeter is under siege by Forsaken Raiders. We can't hold out without reinforcements!
Even with their master dead, those Raider dogs continue to nip at my heels.
Traitors in our ranks must have leaked intel on the project there...
I am leaving for Valhalla. Cassius, I am entrusting you with the cleanup operation here.
I will not fail you.
The Xeno forces here are falling back faster than we are pushing them, and they are leaving behind communications equipment, far more than normal.
What could this mean?
We can worry about that later. First we need to secure the Nexus.
Massive energy spike from the Nexus!
Is Krellus trying to replicate what happened at Asphodel? We'll all be killed!
No... the energy is flowing... upwards?
Whatever he is doing, we need to stop him now.
It looks like I arrived too late, the base is already crawling with rats.
We have to get to the vaults as soon as possible.
Halycon, so nice of you to visit our newest base.
Laugh while you can, scum. You'll be bleeding out face-down in the snow soon enough.
You are just in time for a demonstration of your magnificent Deimos Engine.
So, youve already found it then.
Sir, I thought the Deimos Project was a failure?
It was supposed to be a second Phobos, striking terror into the hearts of our foes from orbit.
But the station's Engine could not be stabilized and the project was scrapped.
We need to secure the vaults first, then pursue Vlade and retrieve the Deimos Engine.
Shouldn't we retrieve the Deimos first, before he escapes, sir?
Don't question my orders! I cant risk them finding anything else here.
I'll send this piece of junk back to the scrap heap where it belongs!
We have secured the Archives. The Forsaken only managed to breach Deimos' chamber before we stopped them.
Make doubly sure. And keep an eye on your own men too. Until we find the traitors that leaked this intel, no one is above suspicion.
Cassius reporting in. Eden is safe and I have captured Krellus and his device.
You have served well. There will be medals for you and your men once this ruckus is all sorted out.
That's not all...
We've managed to analyze the event at the Nexus - it was a powerful long range signal containing a summons for the Xeno Armada!
The Armada, coming to Acheron?! Then there is no time to lose.
We need to prepare our defenses. Go to Avalon Base on Lethe and bring your prisoner. I will rendezvous there once I finish dealing with these thieves.
Roger that.

mission.name: To the Victor go the Spoils

speech.line: Planning on running off to the moon I see. That's good, Acheron is about to be a very unfriendly place for your kind.
I'm not leaving until I have the Deimos Engine... and your head.
Time to smash another one of your pathetic roadblocks.
Another roadblock destroyed. How did a group of Typhon's rejects like you ever think you stood a chance against me?
Typhon was a weak fool. Silus is a charlatan. Yurich has gone soft. It will be us that determine the future of the Raiders, and of Acheron.
Typhon surrendered himself to the blight, making himself their puppet in exchange for power. An act of true weakness.
In the end he abandoned the Raiders and even his quest for revenge against you to serve Kalihmah's desires.
We are different from Typhon. In Sulfuris, we are the masters and the blight beasts are the slaves. We have learned to bend them to our will.
Typhon's greatest gift was banishing us to the Pits. That unforgiving land reshaped us and taught us how to be truly strong.
So I am going to give the rest of Acheron the same gift.
Using the Deimos Engine, we will expand the Sulfuris Acid Pits across all of Acheron.
And then everyone who survives will become stronger. Strong enough to dominate the Bloodthirsty. Strong enough to stand against the Armada. And strong enough to defeat you.
All of those acid fumes must have made you crazy if you think that I'm EVER going allow you to do that with MY Deimos Engine.
Linkage between the Despoiler and the Deimos Engine is complete.
Then it's time to show you the new Acheron.
You don't even know how to use that Engine properly. The Intrepid will make short work of your mech.
If that intel from Daedalus is correct, Halcyon's base should be right around here.
I hope so, sneaking across this empty rock is the most boring thing I've done since we...
There's a patrol! Let's take them out quickly.
It's more fun if you let me handle them my way. I'm sure they'll find us soon, so why worry about it?
Maybe I just want the mission to go right for once, and not have to crash land another stolen shuttle or spend months stuck in a Progenitor-infested nightmare land again.
Looks like we can tap their communications from here once these guards are out of the way.
... another test as soon as possible. We don't have long until the Armada arrives, and I need Excalibur stable.
If only we had a better understanding of the Conduit...
Ah, that Excalibur must be Halcyon's new toy then.
Intrusion detected! Someone is using old access codes to infiltrate our network!
So our old traitorous friends have arrived then? I've been wondering where they have been all this time.
See? We should have just busted through the front door.
I do owe you two for finally getting rid of Typhon for me. If you surrender now, I'll allow you to live, and if you can learn to be obedient, maybe you can even serve me again some day.
You really think we've forgotten all the things you've done? All the people you've killed?
I didn't walk halfway across this boring moon just to bow down to you!
Oh well. I shouldn't have expected reason from scum like you. Deploy the tank!
Is that MY tank? I HATE having to break my own stuff!
Don't worry, I'll fix you up good as new as soon as we get out of here.
Hmm, that didn't slow you down as much as expected. It's time to get serious.
Bring it on, old man.
Since you've made it all the way out here, you must know why I am building the Excalibur.
It's our only shot at defeating the Xeno Armada, which is on its way here at this very moment.
We know, and we aren't going to let you finish this weapon.
So you know, and yet you still intend to oppose me? Do you think the Enclave will treat you better than I will? Hah!
No, but I know that the moment after you use Excalibur to defeat the Armada, you will turn the weapon on Acheron and destroy any who oppose you.
Of course, it is my duty as an Imperial soldier to provide a future for my people by exterminating all of the scum and traitors of this world.
I've got too many friends among those so-called scum to let you do that.
So you'd rather risk letting the Xeno wipe us all out than obey me? Do you even have a plan to stop the Armada?
We'll... figure something out. We always manage to make it through.
Pathetic.
I tire of this foolishness. Cassius, buy me some time. I'll convert the Excalibur to anti-personnel mode, that will be more than enough to eradicate these pests.
They won't get past me.
Please Cassius, stand aside. Halcyon is going to use the Excalibur to kill a lot of innocent people.
Even so, I can't trust you to defeat the Armada. Halcyon's plan provides the best future for the Empire and I won't let you stop him!
I was hoping he would say something like that. Time to crush another foe!
Halcyon! They've broken through!
No matter, the Excalibur will be ready for them.
I'll teach Halcyon not to mess with my tank. Let's go smash his weapon!
According to these plans I extracted from the base, the Excalibur is channeling the Deimos Engine's power through a Xeno device.
If we can remove that device, it should disable the weapon.
Got it. We run in and smash the Xeno bits.
Smash it?! That would release enough energy to vaporize this whole base! We have to remove it carefully.
Blast it! Halcyon is even more devious than I thought. He's devised a way to prevent me from smashing his stuff!
What's Halcyon doing with Xeno tech anyways?
When the fate of my people is at risk there is no option that is too extreme.
If "your people" included more than just your blindly obedient sycophants I might agree.
If I can't break your machine, I'll just have to break your face!
Time to teach you some respect!
Finally! I thought we'd never make it through that awful desert. I just hope this place is as good as those scouts said.
Those scouts also said that nobody who landed on the shore came back.
That just means it's so hospitable here they never wanted to leave!
Looks like they aren't very happy to see us!
Well, now we know what happened to those scouts at least.
Something is off though, why are all these men from different colonies fighting together?
Plenty of our tanks and mechs survived that scuffle with the Red Maw so we should be fine taking down a few -
Something's wrong... nnng...
Jakob!?
This land... is not for you...
Well, you aren't acting much like Jakob anymore. I wonder if that's what happened to these other men too...
Go back...
Go back? We don't have enough supplies to cross the Red Sands again. Besides, every man and woman here left their life in Cyprion behind. We have nothing to go back to!
If you will not leave... you must join...
No thanks, I prefer being in charge.
Now let's see, how to get you back to your senses?
Oh ho! Now this is a sight.
Maybe this thing is what took Jakob over?
My brother falls...
Hmm, I got the wrong one.
You persist... but this place is doomed.
Doomed?
A single power drives all to desire... A single torch consumes a forest once lit...
A single ember burns in the ashes... A single wind carries it to another...
A second flame chokes the world in smoke...
You could just tell me what's going to happen instead of all this cryptic riddle stuff.
But actually, I don't care. Even if you are right, this place is still better than starving to death in the desert or being killed by the Red Maw.
The only problem is you ugly things, but I can handle you.
You have heard and will not listen... There is nothing left for you but to be destroyed.
Don't underestimate me!
If you really knew anything about the future you'd see THIS coming!
So, are you back to normal now?
As normal as a man can be after a giant squid monster moves him around like a puppet.
When that... thing was poking around inside my head, I also got a glimpse into its head.
That huge structure ahead of us is important to them - if we can take it over, we can drive them out.
That's what I like to hear!
This... Nexus is like a wound ripped between dimensions, constantly pouring out vast amounts of energy.
That sounds incredibly dangerous.
I think that's why they are here, to stop anyone else from misusing it.
But since they are using it, there must be a safe way...
I saw enough of how they were using it to figure it out.
I'm at least 80% sure I won't blow us all up.
We should just take over as the guardians of this place. These things are clearly doing a horrible job.
We will skim a bit of energy off the top of the Nexus and live off these fertile lands, meanwhile making sure no one else ever gets their hands on it.
Really we are doing them a favor, taking over their responsibilities.
Truly this place is a worthy paradise.
I think I'll name it... Asphodel.
We've lost contact with our forces that were watching over Typhon's corpse. Your mission is to rendezvous with them, find out what happened, and fix the situation.
At once, your holiness.
May the Sentinels guide you.
This area is still thick with Bloodthirsty - no doubt they are attracted to Typhon's power.
You should *kzzzt* wary, the *kzzzzzzzt*
The connection is gone - looks like I'll have to proceed on my own.
Movement ahead, ready your weapons!
Hold your fire, we aren't infested!
You must be the watchers - I am on a mission from the Council. Follow me and together we can break through to the main base.
The base has been overrun, I'll show you another route.
There's a huge beast ahead. We'll need work together to take it down.
It seems every time we cut down one monster, an even stronger one appears.
Amazing, it seems to have absorbed some of Typhon's essence.

mission.name: The Only Way To Be Sure

speech.line: Now that we've taken this one down, we should purge the corpse.
I can't let you do that. This sample is too valuable to us.
I'm acting under the direct orders of the Council! Defying me means defying the will of the Pantheons!
Hah! I don't obey orders from your foolish Council!
I see now, you aren't survivors - you're heretics!
We are the Nephilim, the true children of the Sentinels.
The great Sentinel Semyaza entrusted us with truths your Council has kept from you.
Truths about our ancient enemy, and how to use their power against them.
And we will use that divine truth to end the Bloodthirsty once and for all!
You set up this jamming field too! I should have known the Bloodthirsty weren't behind that.
Forget about contacting the Council. You should just join us, the true Righteous. It's not too late for you to help us save Acheron.
I'll have no part of your madness.
The Council must be warned. I'm taking this mech down.
Sage, the Nephilim have seized control over Typhon's corpse!
So, the heretics have finally decided to show themselves.
You must not let them finish whatever they are up to.
The history of the Nephilim is forbidden knowledge, but now that they have returned it can be secret no longer.
More than a hundred years ago, we launched a Crusade to slay the beast Oluth and cleanse Orion, but we failed.
Among the Sentinels, six believed the enemy's methods were superior, and taught their followers to use those methods in defiance of our most sacred vows.
At great cost we pushed them deep into the Anakis Caverns and slew the fallen Sentinels.
But we could not destroy them completely.
The great Semyaza foresaw his own demise, and entrusted us with the duty of his glorious resurrection.
Now that we have such a potent vessel, we can bring Semyaza back with greater power than ever before!
Inconceivable blasphemy!
Our enemy does not limit themselves to what is 'safe'. If we are ever to defeat the Bloodthirsty we must be as ruthless as they are.
And if you stand in our way then you are no better than servants of Kalihmah!
Poor heretic... you cannot see that you are the one who has become Kalihmah's pawn.
It is over for you, Semyaza rises already...
I will destroy this abomination, and keep the purity of the true Righteous!
Thanks again for backing us up with these ships, Daedalus.
The people of Artemis Station stand behind you. We still remember the days before Halcyon made the Imperials into his own personal army.
And the Armada needs to be stopped. No matter whose lead you follow, this many Xeno is bad news for any human on Acheron.
I knew the Armada was huge, but I never expected this... Can we even deal with this many ships?
No problem. More ships just means more targets!
We don't have the firepower to go toe to toe with them - we'll have to take a stealthy approach.
Our scouts have confirmed that the majority of their fleet is still in cryosleep. They weren't expecting an attack this far out from Acheron.
Our only chance is to strike quickly and do as much damage as possible before they catch onto us.
We should get close in to the Archmatron's ship, that's where we can do the most damage.
We'll have to slip past these other ships first to get there.
We've been detected by that ship! They're trying to alert the rest of the Armada!
I'm jamming their signal but it won't last - we need to take that ship's bridge out now or this operation is done for!
Just one? This will be easy.
Prepare to be crushed, puny Xeno!
This place is completely smashed, no way they are sending anything from here.
Looks like you were just in time.
The mission continues then. We need to find the right place to strike.
They are totally silent... that can't be right.
Are you sure we intercepted that signal?
I smell a trap...
Even if it is a trap, it's too late to turn back now. We have to push on through.
You took the words right out of my mouth!
Another large ship ahead. Prepare for boarding, we are going to get some intel out of this one.
This is odd, this ship isn't like a normal Xeno warship...
This isn't a warship at all, it's an ark! It's full of Xeno in cryosleep! There are so many of them...
Are these soldiers for the invasion? Just what are the Xeno planning?
Based on our scans, most of the Armada is comprised of ships like this. Even so, the remaining warships still far outnumber our own forces...
They're onto us!
I grabbed a load of data from the ship, so let's get out of here already!
According to this data, the Flagship has a massive neutron bombardment array! They weren't planning on a ground invasion at all, they are just going to wipe Acheron clean from orbit!
If we let them get to Acheron with that weapon, we're all doomed. We have to take it out here.
Would the Excalibur have even been enough to stop this invasion?
If you can get me a connection to the Flagship, I might be able to upload a virus to sabotage the weapon remotely.
Prep a boarding pod, I am going in.
Connection established.
It's no good, the Flagship's defenses are much stronger than the rest of the fleet.
Then I will go down there and break things myself.
Trouble! Multiple ships are closing in on us!
When did they find us? There was no signal burst, unless...
Unless they saw us right from the start and were just waiting to attack!
I've nearly reached the warhead storage.
We won't have enough time for a proper extraction.
Looks like I'm gonna have to jump.
My cybernetics should hold up against the vacuum for a little while.
Now all I need to do is set up a chain reaction and then get out of here.
You've stopped Semyaza, but this battle isn't over yet.
I will not leave this place until I have destroyed every last scrap of the Blight here.
I have sent a specialist to help you cleanse the contamination in this zone.
It looks like we've got quite the mess on our hands.
The Nephilim attack disrupted the quarantine here and the Blight is spreading out of control.
There is another factor to this outbreak.
Typhon's blood was incredibly thick with the Blight, so even when diluted it is irresistible to the Bloodthirsty.
It is what has drawn so many of them here, and as they feed on it they will keep getting stronger.
So we just need to exterminate anything that has consumed the blood, and then problem solved.
If we leave it at that, some other creature will just come along and eat it up again - and the blood is too potent for me to purify it without a Pantheon's aid.
Our only option is to gather up the blood and bring it to the Council to dispose of it completely.
Everything I know is telling me the Blight is to be destroyed, not transported...
But I will trust in the wisdom of your plan.
This Bloom specimen is spreading the Blight all throughout this area, and based on its immense size it must have consumed a large amount of the blood.
We better take it out quick, long-range sensors are picking up an object falling towards the ocean at high speed.
Field operations always have a way of getting interesting...
The object is right on top of us! It's some sort of... Imperial transport pod?
A surprise attack, here?
Cease fire! We are not your enemies!
Tabitha? What are you doing here?
The Xeno shot us down as we escaped from the Armada.
And where is Octane?
He sacrificed himself to give us the chance to make it back.
After all we've been through, I refuse to believe he would let it end like that. I'm sure he's still fighting.
If you are done chatting, we have a whole ocean of Bloodthirsty after us, so make yourselves useful.
Blight-proofed submarines? Your Pantheons really do think of everything!
Cut the blasphemy or I'll put you right back into that escape pod.
So even with Typhon dead, the Bloodthirsty are still this much of a threat?
Don't be so surprised. We fought them for decades before he was even born, and even now swarms still continue to pour from the portals he opened in the Blightlands.
And that's before we even talk about the Xeno in orbit or Halcyon's ever-increasing oppression...
I've got the some kind of huge sea serpent on the scopes!
Excellent. I'd estimate it should have most of the rest of the blood we are looking for.
We should head back, we've removed enough blood that our other forces should be able to finish off the Bloodthirsty in this region.
Send the signal, we are ascending.
We're not out of this yet, there is a huge number of Bloodthirsty converging on us!
Why are they so intent on chasing us now?
Probably because we are hauling around a huge amount of Typhon's blood and they are drawn to it.
They are upon us! Brace yourselves!
The tanks have been ruptured! The blood is leaking out!
This is bad. They are absorbing the blood again, and it's all concentrated in one place.
The Bloodthirsty are merging together!
I AWAKEN.
In... our minds... hnnng...
THE HUNT BEGINS.
DO NOT RESIST, MORSELS.
OUR HUNGER IS ENDLESS, OUR NUMBERS INFINITE.
Now that the Xeno Armada is descending, we need the full might of the Imperials to stand against them.
There's no way that Halcyon would ever work with us.
We've avoided dealing with him for too long.
My contacts have informed me of several existing rebel cells that we can use to jumpstart our efforts.
Halcyon certainly has a way of creating enemies wherever he goes.
I'm in charge around here. I'm glad you are finally ready to make a move against Halcyon.
He's building a new headquarters on top of the Nexus - we can make a big statement by making it ours.
Halcyon is in the city, so we'll have to be careful not to alert him before we can...
We don't have time to wait around. Let's go straight for it.
Attacking me in my own city? Your insolence is matched only by your foolishness.
We claim this building in the name of Free Eden!
You ungrateful brats! Don't you realize everything I have done has been to protect you?
What about the civilians killed by your missile strikes when the Progenitors attacked Eden?
Sometimes sacrifices have to be made to ensure victory.
Acheron is an unforgiving place. You wouldn't last a week without my leadership.
Your leadership is what put us in this situation to begin with! Typhon would have still been our ally against the Bloodthirsty if you had not attacked Asphodel!
I've seized control of the airspace around the Intrepid.
So Artemis Station has betrayed me as well...
We fought off the Armada while you cowered on the moon. We killed Typhon while you sat by.
We never needed you, and now it's time to get rid of you.
Halcyon, we've seized control of the Intrepid's dock. I'll give you one chance to surrender.
Never.
Break in.
Loyal Imperials, rally to me! Kill these traitors!
We're in but... there's no sign of Halcyon here.
Fools, I am already long gone.
Prepare to set out, we have to capture Halcyon before he reaches the Spire.
I wouldn't be so quick to abandon Eden.
The city's autonomous defenses are configured to attack any suspected rebels, and they will be coming online very soon...
The defenses are controlled at Eden HQ, if we can get there we can disable them before this becomes a massacre.
Let's hurry then!
Cassius, slow them down. I don't want them to have any spare time to follow me.
Yes, sir.
How can you follow this coward who threatens his own people just to save his neck?
How can you betray the Imperials and turn us against each other when we have so many enemies just waiting for any sign of weakness to attack?
I've reached the base!
The defenses are starting to come online! Are we too late?
We may have freed the city from Halcyon's grasp, but things are far from stable.
The forces that followed us after the revolution are focused on defending the city and we are seeing a major increase in criminal activity.
We'll just have to deal with it, bigger things are at stake right now.
Emergency report! A heavily armed mech has just showed up in the downtown sector!
Hello Imperials! I am here today to give you a demonstration of Syndicate weaponry!
How did he manage to get that into the city undetected?
Your citizens are quite resourceful when they have been properly motivated...
Daedalus, get the turrets online!
They aren't responding...
I'm afraid I had to take away your toys.
Then we can do this the hard way.
Teiffa, evacuate the citizens from that sector. Daedalus, mobilize our forces.
Excellent, a proper brawl!
Hasn't Eden suffered enough already?
Now that we've shown you what we are capable of, the boss is ready to talk.
Ah, it's so good to finally meet the new governor of Eden.
What is the meaning of this? What do you want with Eden?
You see, we had a agreement with the former ruler...
And it would be in your best interest to make the same agreement.
Halcyon was working with Raiders? I don't believe it.
He was resistant at first, but eventually he realized the value of having someone that could provide him with information on Typhon.
So this how the Syndicate negotiates? By attacking your partners?
Come now Tabitha, don't lie and tell me you would have accepted my offer if I had come peacefully.
We are both very busy people, I am just skipping ahead to the part where I demonstrate what will happen if you foolishly decide to turn me down.
You are the fool if you think I would accept this.
Ah well, I suppose this means I will have to give a better demonstration. Olivia, move to stage two.
Gladly, boss.
While Halcyon was in control we created backdoors all over Eden's systems.
If you insist on turning down the boss' deal we can make things quite painful for you.
Oops, there go your turrets.
That's enough of the demonstration. It's time to come to terms.
You've made a mistake, Darius.
We aren't like Halcyon. It doesn't matter what benefits you might bring us.
Tabitha, I am really quite offended.
The Armada hangs over us, and the attacks from the Bloodthirsty continue.
Even with such inhuman enemies you refuse an offer of help from a fellow human?
I've determined the source of Darius' transmission! It's coming from inside our own Stronghold!
What!?
I let myself in while you were dealing with my subordinates.
Now, I'd like to conclude our business here.
I can't let one of my enemies possess a Nexus, so I am going to make sure you can't use this one.
And I am sure you are well aware of what happens when one tampers with a Nexus.
Of course, if we were allies that wouldn't be a problem.
...somehow this cave stinks even worse than Sulfuris! Is whatever the Forsaken left here really worth it?
The Forsaken excavated and built some extremely dangerous weapons. It would be best that they not fall into anyone else's hands.
It looks like both the Bloodthirsty and Forsaken are long gone, even though they have left plenty of traces.
Wait, I can hear rumbling, be on your guard.
Something is bursting into the cave!
Halt, Children of the Wastes.
This site and its relics are needed to fulfill our holy mission.
Leave now and we will not destroy you.
You won't find the Kor to be such easy prey.
Wait, Silus. I've worked with the Righteous before, I can negotiate with them.
If you must do such pointless things.
There is no need to fight. We fought against Typhon alongside the Council -
Allies of the Council? In that case you must die.
Then we'll do things the Kor way.
The last one standing takes it all!
The Council must be growing truly desperate if it is relying on such barbarians to carry out its missions.
Ha ha, the Kor don't fight for anyone but ourselves.
And right now we are going to teach you a lesson.
You've been underground so long you have forgotten how the world works.
Your Sentinels won't save you from me!
You are unworthy to even be killed by their divine hands!
We will destroy you ourselves.
You think your metal gods have made you strong, but they have only made you slaves.
Unable to deviate from their plans, you are easy to fool.
Oh, Great Sentinel Arakiel, show me your signs so that I may follow your will.
I offer these savages as sacrifices.
While you cowered under the earth and prayed for someone else to save you, we took our fate into our own hands.
We fought and we learned to survive in this merciless world.
And we bowed down to nobody.
Not to the Imperials that invaded our shores. Not to the Bloodthirsty abominations or the traitor Typhon who surrendered to them.
Not to the Xeno who darkened our skies, and we will not bow to you.
The charges are set.
Detonate them and collapse their tunnels! No more Nephilim will get in or out of this cave!
You have lost, Nephilim. No one is coming to save you.
We cannot fail in our mission. Deploy Nidhogg!
Nidhogg is a manifestation of the Sentinels' might!
Even if I am killed, the Great Plan will succeed!
Then die.
That thing is what they've been using to dig tunnels and move freely underground!
That means if we destroy it, they won't be able to continue their assaults.
Atmospheric descent complete. Progenitor activity detected in the wreckage.
Remove them. You are authorized to activate the new agent.
Hybrid unit, you are instructed to eliminate all Progenitors in this region.
What the hell is going on?
Why can I understand you? And more importantly, why am I still alive?
You have been upgraded with an interface device for the Enclave's systems.
You are alive because the Archmatron recognized your exceptional abilities during your attack on the Armada.
That's it? You don't care that I killed your comrades?
You are more useful as an agent than as a pile of scrap.
We have taken precautions to prevent any future incidences of aggression against us.
You are an experimental hybrid unit retaining non-Xeno cognitive function.
We will analyze your actions and determine how you managed to be effective despite clear technological and numerical disadvantage.
And we will replicate this talent to support the continued survival of the Xeno.
Enough discussion. Begin the mission.
Well, I'm no friend to the Progenitors. Maybe a fight is just what I need to clear my head...
I wonder why the Progenitors decided to show up now, this wreck has been sitting untouched for years.
As always, their precise objectives are unknown.
However, they seem to always appear at the most critical moments.
The most critical moments?
We can speculate that their intention is to interfere with us.
And with their time-manipulation abilities it is impossible to know how much they have already interfered in the past.
I've seen that first hand.
Extensive dissection of recovered Progenitor samples has revealed little about the methods behind their abilities.
But they have revealed that the Progenitors are made of an unknown exotic form of matter that can mimic the behavior of normal matter.
We speculate that this means the Progenitors are not native to our universe, although how they arrived here is unknown.
Even if they come from another universe, they can still be destroyed.
This appears to be the last of their ground forces. Dispatch them.
