The enemy has recovered our own aerial units from the crash site and are deploying them against us.
There will be a command unit nearby, if we destroy it we can recover control of our units.
Do you think it's that colossal floating disc?
This will be a good test of your abilities, agent. Clear a path to Uruk and eliminate it.
I have encircled the enemy. It has nowhere left to run.
Time to close in...
It is reacting to our approach, intensify our analysis.
Uruk is beginning to ascend. Destroy it before it reaches the Armada.
We've arrived at the site. It's swarming with Xeno activity.
For your sake, I hope that your info on this signal is correct.
Don't underestimate our skill.
The Armada is really digging in here, we need to move carefully.
Right now we are just investigating, but take notes, we may need to return with greater force later.
The Righteous are north of here at Orion and Mount Pristine, and the Raiders south at Kor.
If we could get them to cooperate with us, we could take out the Armada here before they become fully entrenched.
They weren't willing to work together against Typhon until the last moment. I doubt we can count on them this time.
Detecting hazardous gases ahead.
What are the Xeno up to here?
Do you really think Octane is still alive after all this time?
We might be following this signal to a Xeno scrap heap, or worse, a trap.
I don't care how unlikely it is, I can't ignore the chance that we can still rescue him.
We've been spotted!
I'm done running and hiding from the Xeno!
Intruders detected. It's... Tabitha?!
Octane!? What have the Xeno done to you?
The Xeno spared my life, and now I fight on their side.
Don't give me that! I'll get you out of here and then we'll pull out whatever the Xeno put in your head!
I'm afraid I can't let you do that, Tabitha.
Listen to me, Tabitha. The Xeno have changed me but I am not a mindless slave.
There is information you need to know about the Xeno.
The Armada has come to Acheron to make it their new Homeworld.
Why would they do that? Surely they have better worlds than this war-torn hellscape?
There are no other worlds for them, not anymore. The Armada is all that remains of the Xeno Empire.
Long ago, the Xeno used the power of their Homeworld's Nexus to improve themselves and become the masters of space.
But in time they became reliant on that power.
Now, the Xeno cannot survive without Neocyte crystals, which can form only in the vicinity of a Nexus.
So when we saw Razogoth drive them from their Homeworld...
They lost their source of Neocyte, and their empire collapsed.
The Armada is running on reserves but they won't last very long. That's why most of the Xeno are in stasis.
How are you able to tell me all of this?
I guess it never occured to the Xeno to prevent it.
So all we need to do is strike the Armada now, before they can gather more Neocyte, and then the Xeno will be no more.
That would be a huge mistake.
With nowhere to retreat to, the Xeno won't hesitate to use their most dangerous weapons. You might win, but it will be costly.
And that is just what the Bloodthirsty are waiting for.
The Bloodthirsty? We defeated Typhon.
Not Typhon. Kalihmah.
Kalihmah is unbelievably ancient, and he got that way by being extremely cautious.
He's been keeping the Righteous busy and waiting for a chance to attack Acheron while we are at each other's throats.
Are you telling me to fight alongside the Xeno? They probably planted that idea in your head!
You are likely correct. But still, maybe it's the right move.
The Xeno are different, but so were Yurich and Empress, and we worked with them.
Maybe there's some truth to your words.
But right now, I am getting you out of here. I didn't come this far just to leave you behind.
Tabitha, please stop. I do not want to fight you.
Valhalla... this place brings back memories.
I don't want to linger here. Let's retrieve the device and get out.
If the defector's information is correct, Halcyon's secret vaults are buried under that mountain.
Bloodthirsty ahead! The region is covered with them!
Could Kalihmah have already figured out what we are up to?
We have to assume they don't know yet.
Let's hurry and get to the vault before they realize what's in there.
You are right.
Where did this swarm come from?
We're nowhere near Orion. Were they waiting underground this whole time?
Everything hinges on our ability to deceive Kalihmah until the last moment.
We need to be thinking about our escape as well.
Leaving this Blightbloom behind us could be troublesome.
Then let's destroy it!
Alongside the Excalibur, Halcyon's scientists created the Rhongomiant, a device to amplify its power even further.
However, using it would also destroy the Excalibur.
Halcyon had no use for a weapon that could only fire once, no matter how strong it was.
One shot is all we'll need.
Fortunately Halcyon is too attached to his weapons to throw them away.
More Bloodthirsty, above!
I just hope Octane's mission is going better than this.
Wipe them all out! Anything we leave behind might alert Kalihmah!
There is a large stockpile of mining equipment here.
Both Imperial and Forsaken designs.
It's possible that this swarm was in hibernation underground, and the Imperials or Forsaken disturbed it.
In which case Kalihmah doesn't know what we are up to yet.
Some of this equipment is still functional.
Good, let's use it to break into the Vaults from the side.
This facility is off limits. Return to the surface and fight off the Bloodthirsty.
I didn't expect Halcyon's guards to still be alive in here.
Traitors! Don't let them into the Vault!
The device has been secured. Let's get out of here.
Our tunnel collapsed. It looks like there's only one way to go...
The Bloodthirsty are blocking our escape!
There's only one way to move and that's forwards!
After Gore Typhon's demise, Halcyon returns to the city of Eden to find it under Xeno attack.
Krellus is after the city's hidden Nexus, and he uses it to send a message to the Xeno Armada.
Krellus completes his message, but then is captured by Cassius along with the device he used to interface with the Nexus, The Conduit.
Halcyon races to ready his secret weapon to defend against the Armada.
But the Forsaken attack Valhalla Station and briefly seize the Deimos Engine for their own plans.
Octane and Tabitha catch wind of Halcyon's plans and infiltrate the Avalon moonbase on Lethe.
Halcyon is building a weapon called Excalibur to destroy the Armada.
But they cannot let such a power remain in Halcyon's hands, so they steal the Conduit, disabling the weapon.
Two hundred years ago, a man named Gavron Vex jouneys to the untamed land of Asphodel.
He defeats its Progenitor guardians and takes on the role of the Nexus' guardian, becoming the first King of Asphodel.
Empress' investigation of Typhon's corpse finds a heretic sect of Righteous, the Nephilim.
The Nephilim are using Typhon's blood to resurrect their fallen Sentinel, Semyaza.
Octane, Tabitha, and Daedalus meet the Xeno Armada in combat as it arrives at Acheron.
Despite its overwhelming size, the Armada seems strangely devoid of life.
Octane destroys the Flagship's main weapon but is forced to stay behind as the others leave and is presumed dead.
Empress and Gaia fight a Bloodthirsty infestation in the waters around Orion, caused by Typhon's blood spilling from Semyaza.
Tabitha and Daedalus splash down from orbit and are forced to join the fight.
Tabitha and Daedalus stage a revolution against Halcyon's rule in Eden.
They succeed, but Halcyon manages to escape to his stronghold in Ashrock to regroup.
Newly liberated Eden is attacked by the shadowy Raider group known as The Syndicate.
They once had dealings with Halcyon, and warn Tabitha of the consequences of not making a deal with them.
Tabitha fights back but eventually gives in once the Syndicate threatens the people of Eden.
Silus and Yurich team up to recover Forsaken technology buried in the caves under Sulfuris.
The Nephilim also arrive with their eyes on the artifacts, but they prove no match for the Raiders.
The Armada descends to the surface, looking to reclaim the wreck of their Worldship.
Octane survived, but he has been modified by the Enclave and is now their agent.
Uruk and the Progenitors launch a devastating attack that saps much of the Armada's remaining resources.
Following a lead from her new Syndicate 'allies', Tabitha arrives at the Worldship.
The Xeno are building a city there, and transforming the environment to be more like their homeworld.
Tabitha encounters Octane and they struggle with their new places in the world.
The two of them make a plan to deal with the lurking threat of the Bloodthirsty ancient Kalihmah.
Halcyon!
You have nowhere left to run to.
Octane, you've saved me the trouble of chasing you down.
Although you're nothing but a puppet now.
Being a traitor to your nation wasn't enough for you, you even betrayed humanity!
Such words mean nothing coming from you after all you've done.
All I've done? Ungrateful brat!
I rebuilt the Imperials from a ragtag band of nobodies into the most powerful army in the world!
Without me you fools would never have survived!
Without you, Typhon could have been our ally, and he would have never opened the portal to Tartarus.
It's only your recklessness and lust for power that put the Imperials in this situation to begin with!
Of course the Xeno wouldn't want anyone else to gain the power of the Nexus.
I did what I had to do to, and I sacrificed what I had to sacrifice.
Now Warden, crush this puppet.
Old man, these outdated machines won't stop me.
I'm going to peel back your defenses layer by layer until you are all alone.
First I'll blow your aircraft out of the sky.
Then I'll bombard your Spire until there's nothing left but rubble.
Spoken like the Xeno scum you are.
I see your words are all you have left to fight me with.
Nonsense. Deploy the air forces and stop the Xeno in their tracks!
Excellent.
Did you forget about Xeno air supremacy?
We'll see how the dregs of your Armada do against my elite pilots.
Ah, here's the base.
All I have to do is smash this!
You may have destroyed the Defender but your forces are in tatters.
Look at your own side, old man.
Fool! You thought this was all I had?
Activate the Spire!
The Spire is equipped with the latest Imperial shielding technology.
My reinforcements will arrive and blast you to scrap metal long before you can break in.
Ah well, I suppose I have no option left but to retreat.
Incoming communication from Cassius.
It's too late to run now, Octane!
Put him through.
I have a present for you from your old friend.
How did you get those codes, traitor?
Code Y6-FN-E1X21, execute reset!
Code accepted. Access granted.
Welcome back, Cassius.
Perfect timing, Daedalus.
Halcyon! Let's finish things face-to-face!
I got the parts for the Rhongomiant. How did things go on your side?
Halcyon is... no more. And I made a big enough commotion that Kalihmah couldn't have missed it.
I'll begin the installation immediately.
We have no idea how long it will take Kalihmah to figure out what we are doing once it arrives.
Hybrid unit...
Wait, what are you doing here? This wasn't part of the plan.
The Archmatron has granted me the opportunity to prove your weakness.
We will engage in combat, and if I am victorious, the Enclave will no longer lower itself to making 'alliances'.
Could they have picked a worse time to pull this on us?
At least Kalihmah isn't here... yet.
It is time to end this failed experiment.
Alright Kaszatah, if you want a rematch I'm all yours.
Since arrival, the Armada has activated many additional combat forms.
This will not be the same as last time.
If you say so...
Incoming transmission from the surface...
We're reading massive earthquakes at the Kytos Nexus!
Kalihmah is on its way, we don't have much time left!
Ignore me at your peril!
Your ship is wrecked.
Give up this pointless struggle and help us against Kalihmah.
It isn't over yet. I will enter the field myself.
A spatial rift is forming above Kytos!
You, who are not from the homeworld should be nothing more than an obedient soldier.
The rift is rising and expanding rapidly!
We're out of time.
Skip the checks, just get this thing operational, now!
The Archmatron is watching. I will prove the might of the Enclave has no equal.
It's your foolishness that has no equal!
THE OVERCONFIDENCE OF MORTALS IS ETERNAL.
NOW YOU SEE HOW LITTLE YOUR INSIGNIFICANT DISTRACTIONS HAVE YIELDED.
It's reforming quickly, we won't get another chance like this.
The Rhongomiant is totally slagged, there's no way to fire it again.
REJOICE, FOR YOU WILL SOON BECOME PART OF ME, AS IS THE DESTINY OF ALL LIFE AND ALL WORLDS.
I've recovered the Deimos Engine from the wreckage.
If we can get it close enough to the heart, we could overload it...
It will be a dangerous mission, I-
We're going in together this time.
MY CHILDREN, THE AGE OF HUNGER IS OVER.
IT IS TIME TO AWAKEN AND FEAST!
Urgent message from Eden!
Huge swarms of Bloodthirsty are emerging from deep underground all over Acheron!
AND WHEN THE FEAST IS DONE, THIS WORLD WILL BECOME ANOTHER HOME FOR US.
Kalihmah is descending towards Acheron, it does not seem to have noticed us.
Well I don't plan on giving any warning.
Watch out!
I may have spoken too soon...
IT IS CLOSE NOW.
THE MOMENT I HAVE WAITED SO LONG FOR.
NO LONGER WILL MORTAL TRICKERY DELAY MY RIGHTFUL FEAST.
I'm fed up with this gluttonous self-important blob!
It's time to teach Kalihmah a lesson.
You've lived so long that you forgot you are mortal too.
You can bleed and die just like the rest of us!
You forgot what it means to struggle to stay alive.
We'll remind you what the fear of death feels like!
IS SOMETHING TICKLING AT MY HEART?
IT IS TIME TO BANISH THESE DISTRACTIONS.

star_type.name: Turns
star_type.desc: Defeat the Mission in X turns or less.

star_type.name: Cards in Deck
star_type.desc: Defeat the Mission with X or less cards in your deck, besides your Commander.

star_type.name: Damage Received
star_type.desc: Defeat the Mission with X damage or less dealt to your Commander.

star_type.name: Card Casualties
star_type.desc: Defeat the Mission with X Cards or less being destroyed.
